Package se.arkalix.util.concurrent

Class FutureAnnouncement<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.arkalix.util.concurrent.FutureAnnouncement<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - Type of value that will be contained in the announced Result if the Future in question completes successfully.
    public class FutureAnnouncement<V>
extends java.lang.Object
    Announces when the result of some Future becomes available to a set of subscribers.

    All subscribers are guaranteed to be notified about the completion of the Future in question on the same thread.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • cancel

        public void cancel​(boolean mayInterruptIfRunning)
        Signals that the result of this FutureAnnouncement no longer is of interest and that it is not be announced to any subscribers.

        No guarantees whatsoever are given about any further implications of this call. The completer of the Future this announcement contains may receive a notification about the cancellation, and might react to receiving it.

        Parameters:
        mayInterruptIfRunning - Whether or not the thread executing the task associated with the Future wrapped by this announcement, if any, should be interrupted. If not, in-progress tasks are allowed to complete. This parameter may be ignored.

      • resultIfAvailable

        public java.util.Optional<Result<V>> resultIfAvailable()
        Gets the result of this FutureAnnouncement if it already is available.
        Returns:
        Result of this FutureAnnouncement, if available.

      • subscribe

        public Future<V> subscribe()
        Subscribes to the completion of the Future contained in this FutureAnnouncement.

        All subscribers are guaranteed to be notified about the completion of the Future in question on the same thread, which means that even if another subscriber may have mutated the value before your subscriber was notified, there is no risk for race conditions. If the result already has been announced when this method is called, the returned Future is completed immediately with the result.

        Returns:
        Future completed with the announced value, when it becomes available.
